CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this area chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Home Essentials relative to Outlet Centers?
SRP.A: Home Essentials is {above} Outlet Centers in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total in-store foot traffic?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Pop-Up Shops}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total in-store foot traffic?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Fashion Boutiques}.

VE.Q: What is Pop-Up Shops's In-Store Foot Traffic in 2012?
VE.A: Pop-Up Shops's in-store foot traffic in 2012 is {23588.24} visitors/day.

VE.Q: What is Fashion Boutiques's In-Store Foot Traffic in 2002?
VE.A: Fashion Boutiques's in-store foot traffic in 2002 is {8694.52} visitors/day.

VE.Q: What is Home Essentials's In-Store Foot Traffic in 2012?
VE.A: Home Essentials's in-store foot traffic in 2012 is {3578.24} visitors/day.

VE.Q: What are the in-store foot traffic of Pop-Up Shops, Outlet Centers, and Home Essentials in 1999?
VE.A: Pop-Up Shops's in-store foot traffic is {16106.89} visitors/day, Outlet Centers's in-store foot traffic is {18122.03} visitors/day, Home Essentials's in-store foot traffic is {11365.45} visitors/day.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum In-Store Foot Traffic in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum in-store foot traffic is {2008.02} visitors/day.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum In-Store Foot Traffic in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global maximum in-store foot traffic is {27366.98} visitors/day.

EVJ.Q: What is the highest In-Store Foot Traffic level recorded for Fashion Boutiques?
EVJ.A: Fashion Boutiques reached approximately {19533.62} visitors/day in {1995}.

EVJ.Q: What is the lowest In-Store Foot Traffic level recorded for Fashion Boutiques?
EVJ.A: Fashion Boutiques's lowest recorded level is approximately {2008.02} visitors/day in {2011}.

SC.Q: What is the average total In-Store Foot Traffic?
SC.A: The average total in-store foot traffic is {65412.41} visitors/day.

NF.Q: Which years did the total In-Store Foot Traffic go below 50346.99 visitors/day? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {50022.29} visitors/day in {2004}, {43267.54} visitors/day in {2010}, {44659.26} visitors/day in {2011}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total In-Store Foot Traffic exceed 76114.69 visitors/day? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {88198.05} visitors/day in {1997}, {76227.35} visitors/day in {1999}, {80662.60} visitors/day in {2000}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total In-Store Foot Traffic fall between 60069.30 and 66392.39 visitors/day? Please list the years and corresponding total values.

NC.Q: Was the total In-Store Foot Traffic in 1997 higher or lower than in 2005?
NC.A: The total in-store foot traffic in 1997 was {higher} than in 2005.

NC.Q: Was the total In-Store Foot Traffic in 2000 higher or lower than in 2008?
NC.A: The total in-store foot traffic in 2000 was {higher} than in 2008.

NC.Q: Was the total In-Store Foot Traffic in 2003 higher or lower than in 2009?
NC.A: The total in-store foot traffic in 2003 was {higher} than in 2009.

NC.Q: Between 2000 and 2007, did the total In-Store Foot Traffic experience a larger or smaller change than between 2007 and 2011?
NC.A: The change in total in-store foot traffic between 2000 and 2007 was {larger} than between 2007 and 2011.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Pop-Up Shops} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Tech Gadget Hubs, Home Essentials, Fashion Boutiques, Outlet Centers, Pop-Up Shops}.
